byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from Albany.

abstract: New York State Gov Andrew M Cuomo drops Dream Act immigration reform measure as well as proposed education tax credit from budget negotiations after Republicans and Democrats fail to reach agreement on linked issues.
lead_paragraph: A spokeswoman for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said that the Dream Act, which would allow high school graduates who are undocumented immigrants to apply for state aid to college, might have to be taken up later.

headline.main: Cuomo Drops Dream Act and Education Tax Credit From Budget
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Drops Dream Act and Education Tax Credit From Budget

snippet: A spokeswoman for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said that the Dream Act, which would allow high school graduates who are undocumented immigrants to apply for state aid to college, might have to be taken up later.

keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
